title.narrative: UNSCR 1325 Kvinna till Kvinna - Mindefense COL
UNSCR 1325 kurs Kvinna till Kvinna - Försvarsdepartamentet COL

description.narrative: Capacity building to the Ministry of Defense and the military forces i Colombia on the United Nations Security Council resolution 1325 on women, peace and security. The contribution aims at strengthening the capacity of the Ministry of Defense, and the several institutions that form part of it, to implement the women, peace and security agenda in terms of both knowledge and tools. The program is built upon four modules encompassing theoretical and practical approaches: 1) Exchange of experiences; 2) Theoretical knowledge - understanding the women, peace and security agenda; 3) Methods and tools for change; 4) Methods and tools to implement the women, peace and security agenda (best practices). Kvinna till Kvinna will be responsible of the implementation of the contribution, but there will be a strong coordination with the Folke Bernardotte Academy (FBA), The Embassy of Sweden in Bogotá and the Ministry of Defense. This will be done during all the stages of the contribution.

Insatsen syftar till att stärka kapaciteten hos Försvarsministeriet, och de institutioner som utgör en del av det, att implementera agendan för kvinnor, fred och säkerhet avseende både kunskap och verktyg. Programmet är baserat på fyra moduler som täcker teoretiska och praktiska förhållningssätt: 1) Utbyte av erfarenheter; 2) Teoretisk kunskap – förståelse av agendan för kvinnor, fred och säkerhet; 3) Metoder och redskap för förändring; 4) Metoder och verktyg för att genomföra agendan för kvinnor, fred och säkerhet (bästa praxis). Kvinna till Kvinna kommer att vara ansvariga för implementeringen av insatsen, men det kommer att ske i stark samverkan med Folke Bernadotteakademin (FBA), Sveriges Ambassad i Bogotá och Försvarsministeriet. Detta kommer att utföras under alla faser av insatsen.

The main objective of the intervention is to strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Defense, the Military Forces and the Police, to implement the women, peace and security agenda (WPS) in terms of knowledge and tools. The program is built upon four modules encompassing theoretical and practical approaches. 1) Exchange of experiences; 2) Theoretical knowledge - understanding the women, peace and security agenda; 3) Methods and tools for change; 4) Methods and tools to implement the WPS agenda (best practices).

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Agreement UNSCR 1325 Kvinna till Kvinna - Mindefense COL
Decision on contribution UNSCR 1325 Kvinna till Kvinna Mindefense COL

description.narrative:
22 members (13 women and 9 men) from the Ministry of Defense, Army, Navy and Police, accomplished the capacity building - out of 25 final participants selected in the recruitment process - and their change projects were finished and approved by Kvinna till Kvinna. The participants represented the different institutions as follows: 8 from the Army; 8 from the Police and 6 from the Navy. The participants improved their knowledge and have a broader understanding of the women, peace and security agenda.
At the end of the project (February 2021), 40% of the projects had been implemented or were on-going: 6 of them within the Army, and 3 within the Police. The rest was still pending to be implemented.
According to the evaluation, the change projects contributed to some extent to transform the frameworks of the organizations, incorporating objectives on gender and human rights, contributing to the implementation of the UNSCR 1325. Some examples of transformations at the institutional level are the creation of Gender Offices inside the Police and Army, or the inclusion of indicators of gender-based violence in the statistis in the Police.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
